clinical_study.brief_title: Leuven Growing Into Deficit Follow-up Study
clinical_study.official_title: Neurocognitive Development in Children With Congenital Heart Disease: Growing Into Deficit

brief_summary.textblock: The key objective of the Leuven growing-into-deficit (GID) follow-up-study is to test the hypothesis that children with a congenital heart disease (CHD) show more neurocognitive impairment at the second follow-up at 7 years old than at the first follow-up at the age of 4, compared to healthy controls.

primary_outcome.measure: reaction time (RT) and error rates of inhibitory control (Response Organization Objects, ROO) (Amsterdam Neuropsychological Tasks, ANT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: reaction time (RT) and error rates of cognitive flexibility (ROO, ANT) and working memory (Memory Search - Objects 2 Keys, ANT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean RT + standard deviation (SD) of RT on computerized alertness task (Baseline Speed, ANT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of taps on computerized tapping tasks (ANT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: IQ measures (Revised Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence, WPPSI-R)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years
one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Child Behavior CheckList T-scores for internalizing and externalizing problems
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory - Generic Score Scales (PedsQL) to quantify quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function (BRIEF) to measure executive functions (parent and teacher version)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Teacher Report Form (TRF) T-scores for internalizing and externalizing problems at school
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of medical problems (e.g. head trauma), interventions and operations since first follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one testpoint at age of 7 years

arm_group.description: Seven-year-old children with CHD who were four years old when they participated in Paediatric ICU follow-up study (i.e. first follow-up time point) (Neurocognitive development of children four years after critical illness and treatment with tight glucose control, Clinical Trials # NCT00214916). The children of the CHD-group underwent cardiac surgery as infants (=<1year).

Seven-year-old healthy control children who were four years old when they participated in Paediatric ICU follow-up study (i.e. first follow-up time point) (Neurocognitive development of children four years after critical illness and treatment with tight glucose control, Clinical Trials # NCT00214916). These children have never undergone cardiac surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Seven-year-old children with CHD and healthy seven-year-old control children

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Seven-year-old children with CHD and healthy control children who were four years old when they participated in Paediatric ICU follow-up study (i.e. first follow-up time point) (Neurocognitive development of children four years after critical illness and treatment with tight glucose control, Clinical Trials # NCT00214916). The children of the CHD-group underwent cardiac surgery as infants (=<1year).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Genetic syndromes (Down, 22q11del), known to result in neurocognitive impairment
- IQ < 70
- Lack of baseline neurocognitive measurements during first follow-up
- Date of birth before February 2005
